summary: This is an email or internal memo from August 12, 2019, regarding a log-keeping error at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York concerning inmate Jeffrey Epstein. It notes that the wrong logbook (a 'companion log') was initially used instead of the required 'Staff Suicide Watch log' for an inmate named Thomas, and that the correct log was subsequently completed with identical entries.

events.title: Logbook Error Discovered and Corrected at MCC NY
events.description: Staff at MCC New York discovered that the wrong logbook (a 'companion log') was used to document watch procedures for inmate Thomas, instead of the required 'Staff Suicide Watch log'. A second, correct log was completed with identical entries.

keyFacts: On August 12, 2019, a procedural error was documented at MCC New York regarding inmate monitoring logs.
Staff used an incorrect '1/M companion log' for inmate Thomas instead of the mandated 'Staff Suicide Watch log'.
The error was discovered by a staff member identified as DTS, who then completed the correct log with entries identical to the first.
The document originates from or is addressed to the 'Associate Warden' of MCC New York's Program Department.
The context strongly implies this log-keeping incident is related to the high-profile detention and subsequent death of Jeffrey Epstein, though he is not explicitly named in this fragment.
